components.name: Backup as a Service || Veeam Backup Managed

incidents.name: [RBX2B][Hosted private Cloud] - Hosted private Cloud hosts and Backup management

incident_updates.body: Update : Here's the current update : All hosts are fully operational and 83% of datastores. The teams are still mobilized to fix the remaining storage.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Update :Our teams are continuing to restore hosts and datastores in room 29. We will get back to you as soon as we can.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Update : Here's the current update : We currently have 75% of the datastores and 90% of the hosts operational. The teams are still mobilized and will work all night (France time zone) for the remaining hosts and storage. Our next update will take place around 09:00 UTC.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Update : After the work carried out by our technical teams, we currently have 50% of datastores and 85% of hosts that are operational. The teams are still mobilized and will work throughout the night (France timezone) for the remaining hosts and storage. Our next update will be around 06:00 UTC.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Update : We are starting to restart the affected datastores. A manual restart of the VMs on the client side will be necessary for the services to be effective. As a reminder, the return to service will depend on the control of equipments by the technical teams. Our teams are mobilised to restore services as quickly as possible.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Update : Our teams are electrically checking Row B of Room 29. Following this check and depending on the state of equipments, the datastores will gradually be brought back into service.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Update : Following the recommissioning of Row A, the capacity of the Hosted Private Cloud hosts is comming to returned progressively to normal. Our team control the resumption of hosts activity to avoid a temperature overload that could lead to an over incident.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Ongoing Actions: Our teams continue to work on the datastores.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Ongoing Actions: Veeam service is available again. Our teams are still working on the unavailable datastores. We estimate that the whole situation will get back to normal in 24 hours.

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Ongoing Actions: Our teams stopped temporary the Veeam backup service in order to make all the other services available. We will keep you updated on the situation

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Ongoing Actions: Management is gradually coming back. Our teams are still working to solve the problem

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Start time: 19/07/2022 12:59 UTC User impact : Management down of some PCCs and backup will fail today for most of RBX customers. Also datastores on RBX2B might be unavailable. Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2B Scope of impact : Veeam backup and management of some PCC. Root cause : A technical problem in our cooling system caused the incident Ongoing Actions: Our teams are currently working to solve the problem

affected_components.name: VMware Private Cloud || RBX - Management plane

incident_updates.body: Start time: 19/07/2022 09:47 UTC User impact : Some zpool are not mounted on the gwssl, sftp access issue. No impact on the production datastore is detected. Only requests for additional zpools are affected by the incident. Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX2B Scope of impact : Gateway ssl Root cause : Incident caused by operation on a maintenance about storage switchover. Ongoing actions : A fix in progress.

Start time : 20/07/2022 22:00 UTC End time : 21/07/2022 04:00 UTC Service impact : A few seconds of Input/Output freeze when the service will do a switchover (2 times) Service improvement : The objective of this change is to upgrade the switch version to maintain consistency.

Start time : 21/07/2022 02:00 UTC
End time : 21/07/2022 04:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement: As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be updating our network equipment.

Start time : 21/07/2022 04:00 UTC End time : 21/07/2022 07:00 UTC Service impact : A few seconds of Input/Output freeze when the service will do a switchover (2 times) Service improvement : The objective of this change is to upgrade the switch version to maintain consistency.

Start time : 21/07/2022 22:00 UTC End time : 22/07/2022 04:00 UTC Service impact : A few seconds of Input/Output freeze when the service will do a switchover (2 times) Service improvement : The objective of this change is to upgrade the switch version to maintain consistency.

Start time : 22/07/2022 04:00 UTC End time : 22/07/2022 07:00 UTC Service impact : A few seconds of Input/Output freeze when the service will do a switchover (2 times) Service improvement : The objective of this change is to upgrade the switch version to maintain consistency.

Start time : 25/07/2022 06:00 UTC End time : 29/07/2022 16:00 UTC Service impact : None Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling an update for VMware NSX related product.

Start time : 25/07/2022 07:00 UTC End time : 28/07/2022 16:00 UTC Service impact : Only the VCSA management will be impacted during maintenance. Your VMs will continue to function, as will the hosts, storage and network. Service improvement: As part of our continuous improvement, we will be updating vCenter Server Appliance.
Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Start time : 18/07/2022 18:00 UTC End time : 22/07/2022 17:00 UTC Service impact : None Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling an update for VMware NSX related product.
Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

Start time : 12/07/2022 06:00 UTC End time : 05/08/2022 15:00 UTC Description : Builds will be pushed to the host by OVHcloud, then Customer will put the host in maintenance Mode and reboot it. Customer will have the possibility to schedule that action during July, as desired.
